attachments.fallback: GitHub: ARM versions available ? · Issue #181 · heptio/sonobuoy
attachments.text: Do you know if ARM images exist ? I try that but it fails : $ docker pull <http://gcr.io/heptio-images/sonobuoy-arm:v0.10.0|gcr.io/heptio-images/sonobuoy-arm:v0.10.0> Error response from daemon: manifest for <http://gcr.io/heptio-images/sonobuoy-arm:v0.10|gcr.io/heptio-images/sonobuoy-arm:v0.10>....
attachments.title: ARM versions available ? · Issue #181 · heptio/sonobuoy

text: Hi <@U0AHWBL3U> - I chimed in at <https://github.com/heptio/sonobuoy/issues/181>
hi, anyone knows if ARM images exist for sonobuoy from Heptio ?
ah, good point
in `lang_image`
probably the main thing is base image selection
For cross-compilation, probably not a lot
(only for pure go binaries, but everything we dockerize currently is pure go, so yay)
recent versions of rules_go let you set goos and goarch on go_binary
<@U0EFRDLSJ> how much would be involved in getting multi-arch support into the rules_docker bazel rules?
just sent this out to the Works on Arm newsletter <https://github.com/WorksOnArm/worksonarm-news/blob/master/2017-W51.md#google-container-registry-supporting-multiarch-via-phil-estes-ibm>
<@U09R0N2BF> the docs for multi-platform manifests on GCR live at <https://cloud.google.com/container-registry/docs/concepts/image-formats> per <@U0A6CUU5A>
@estesp has his manifest-tool project
<@U09R0N2BF> talked with folks in-person at KubeCon and they said it has been gradually rolled out during the last days
alternately: how did you learn this was now supported on gcr?
are there any docs on using this?
yeah, that tweet was my motivation for pinging the channel
cc <@U0UV07D8T> FYI :clap::skin-tone-2:
I'll rebase my PRs and we can take a look aftet v1.9 is out
@ixdy ASAP I guess :grin:

text: FYI everyone :grin: <https://twitter.com/estesp/status/940322566937501699>

<@U0BM389D4> so when are we going to try to take advantage of multi-arch docker images? :)

attachments.text: What this PR does / why we need it: Currently, kubeadm will deploy kube-proxy of the type master architecture even if the node is different architecture than master. This PR will deploy kube-proxy ...
attachments.title: Deploy multi-arch kube-proxy ds by mkumatag · Pull Request #53598 · kubernetes/kubernetes

text: PR - <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/53598>
<@U09R0N2BF> <@U0BM389D4> I've submitted the PR to create different `kube-proxy` ds for different architecture which should support multi-arch k8s cluster via kubeadm.
<@U0BM389D4> that would be awesome. thanks!
<@U74KSREUT> I can push v1.8.0-rc-1 now if you like
<@U0BM389D4> I tried using 1.7.5 with no luck :disappointed:

<@U74KSREUT> uploaded a file: <https://kubernetes.slack.com/files/U74KSREUT/F796SCT61/image.png|luxas kube-proxy repo> and commented: <@U0BM389D4> thanks. your dockerhub repo is missing kube-proxy 1.8+. Did you take those down?
does the scheduler have affinity/anti-affinity support for architecture?
gotcha. but not today
for example: `kubectl -n kube-system set image daemonset/kube-proxy kube-proxy=luxas/kube-proxy:v1.8.0-beta.1` if you're testing out v1.8
<@U74KSREUT> you need to use the `luxas/kube-proxy` image
but indeed, not now
<@U09R0N2BF> it's gonna be once we get manifest lists
I'm not sure having clusters with more than one node architecture is supported
on my head node (amd64), I use kubectl -n kube-system set image daemonset/kube-proxy kube-proxy=luxas/kube-proxy:0luxas_kube-proxy-amd64
has anyone gotten this to work?

attachments.title: kubernetes/kubernetes

text: Working on getting guestbook example for multi arch - <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/tree/master/examples/guestbook> . I'm almost done with docker images and in dilemma how to handle the deployment and service yaml files for deployment purpose. What is the best solution here? Creation of different yaml files with different imagenames or have some sort of login in the testfile to replace the imagenames runtime?
<@U4QU9CXFA> no unfortunately
Are you at Dockercon?
<@U0BM389D4> - I'm sharpening up my Terraform skills on a project with a shorter fuse (for Red Hat Summit in May), hope to get back to this soon.
Hi <@U0BM389D4> !
<@U0A6A01FG> status changed now :grin:
How's the Packet CI work proceeding?
<@U4QU9CXFA> around?
Thanks <@U0BM389D4> for creating this group and inviting me.. :slightly_smiling_face:
For problem 2, I'm going to switch to arm-linux-gnueabihf-gcc
Oh wow, I didn't spot that this channel was just created today! What serendipity.
I'm just starting my investigation now, but I thought I'd post the issues here in case anyone can offer any hints
Problem 2 is: `exec: "arm-linux-gnueabi-gcc": executable file not found in $PATH`
Problem 1 is: `/opt/bin/flanneld: relocation error: /lib/libpthread.so.0: symbol __libc_vfork, version GLIBC_PRIVATE not defined in file libc.so.6 with link time reference`

I'm a/the flannel maintainer and we use kube-cross to build flannel on different platforms. mike danese has recently bumped the kube-cross version that we use (to get a newer version of go) but now we're hitting some problems. Is this an appropriate place to find help?
Enjoy :palm_tree: and :soccer:
Yep, slack ftw :palm_tree:
Sounds good.  I take it the palm tree means "I am on holiday"?
Will look closer to that next week, but just came in quickly here to spawn the discussion!
Could we `docker load` those images, and thus we don't need gcr?
And I thought you'd compiled a list of all the images that kubeadm needs to run a cluster?
kops has the ability to "docker load" images at boot
I'm thinking more that a lot of people want the ability to load docker images from their own http server / s3 bucket
Yeah, I'm talking with some CNCF ppl about that too
Primarily because of people that want to be PCI compliant or something like that
Idea: there's been discussions about not relying on GCR for other reasons
Haha <@U0A6A01FG>, just got the ping that the channel was created that I had waited for and felt for inviting some ppl :slightly_smiling_face:
I have your video bookmarked :slightly_smiling_face:
In any case, we should work together to bring up kops on  scaleway
Or is this your holiday?
Aren't you supposed to be on holiday <@U0BM389D4>?
But will put together some resources on this matter in the coming week
Biggest blocker right now is GCR not supporting v2 schema 2 properly. I've been in touch with the GCR team but haven't got a proper response
And slides: <http://slides.com/lucask/kubecon-berlin#/>
